story.text: MINSK Jan 3 Belarus, embroiled in a row over energy with its political ally Russia, said on Wednesday it had imposed a customs duty on Russian crude oil exports across its territory, effective from Jan. 1, 2007. The duty amounts to $45 per tonne of Russian crude shipped across Belarus to consumers in Europe, Belarussian Prime Minister Sergei Sidorsky said in a statement read to journalists.
story.title: belarus slaps customs duty on russian oil transit
